intro: Alyssum parvulum, commonly known as dwarf alyssum, is a low-growing flowering plant native to the western United States. It features small, fragrant flowers that range in color from white to pink, blooming throughout the summer months. The plant has dense, mat-forming foliage that is often used in rock gardens and as a ground cover. It prefers well-drained soil and full sun, making it a hardy choice for coastal and arid regions. Its compact size and long blooming period make it a popular ornamental plant in horticulture.
